articles.title: Mary Kate Koch
articles.contents:
Mary Kate Koch
          
          
          Home
          Publications
          ☰
          
          
      
        
          
            
              
            
              Mary Kate Koch
            
            
              
                
                    
                      
                         LinkedIn

            I am interested in how individuals navigate difficult
            life transitions. I approach this research program from a
            lifespan perspective, and with a diverse set of quantitative
            and qualitative methodologies.
            Currently, I am a postdoctoral research associate at the
            University of Florida. I am working on an NIH grant to
            understand the ways in which people narrate their life
            stories and interact with their providers may impact health
            outcomes at the end of life.
            During my PhD Training at Cornell University, I
            researched how youth make sense of the physical and social
            changes brought on by puberty to better understand why
            pubertal change is associated with such a rise in distress
            during the adolescent transition.
            I have methodological expertise in structural equation
            modeling, content analysis, and computational text analysis.
            See my publications page for
            examples of my work.
          
        
      
    

    
      
        
          
            
              
            
              Mary Kate Koch

articles.title: Publications
articles.contents:
If you’d like a pdf of an article and it’s not available to you, email me.
Published or in-press
Koch, M. K., & Mendle, J. (2022). In their
own words: Finding meaning in girls’ experiences of puberty. Child
Development. https://doi.org/10.1111/cdev.13836
Koch, M. K., & Wang, Q. (in press)
Autobiographical memory. In Levesque (Ed.), Encyclopedia of
Adolescence. Springer.
Garavito, D. M. N., & Koch, M. K. (in
press). Coming of age in the eyes of the law: The conflict between
Miranda, J.D.B., and puberty. American Criminal Law
Review.
Koch, M. K., & Mendle, J. (2021). Real world
skills in a virtual world: An innovative activity for teaching
developmental psychopathology. Teaching of Psychology. https://doi.org/10.1177/00986283211042309
Koch, M. K., Mendle, J., & Beam, C. R.
(2020) Psychological distress amid change: Role disruption in girls
during the adolescent transition. Research on Child and Adolescent
Psychopathology, 48, 1211-1222. https://doi.org/10.1007/s10802-020-00667-y
Mendle, J., Beam, C. R., McKone, K. M. P., & Koch, M.
K. (2020). Puberty and transdiagnostic risks for mental health.
Journal of Research on Adolescence, 30, 687 705. https://doi.org/10.1111/jora.12552
Mendle, J., & Koch, M. K. (2019). The
psychology of puberty: What aren’t we studying that we should? Child
Development Perspectives, 13, 166-172. https://doi.org/10.1111/cdep.12333
McGuire, T. G., McCormick, K. C., Koch, M. K.,
& Mendle, J. (2019). Pubertal maturation and longitudinal
trajectories of depression during early adolescence. Frontiers in
Psychology. https://doi.org/10.3389/fpsyg.2019.01362
